## Sources of Finance

This presentation covers the various financing options available to organizations.

- Internal vs. external sources
- Short-term, medium-term, and long-term options
- Matching financing to investment needs
- Cost and control implications

## The Financing Decision Context

The financing decision is closely linked to investment decisions:

```{mermaid}
flowchart TD
    A[Identify investment opportunities] --> B[Determine financing needs]
    B --> C[Evaluate available sources of finance]
    C --> D[Select optimal financing mix]
    D --> E[Implement financing plan]
    E --> F[Monitor and review financing structure]
```

## Categories of Finance Sources

Finance can be categorized in several ways:

1. **By source**: Internal vs. External
2. **By term**: Short-term, Medium-term, Long-term
3. **By type**: Debt vs. Equity vs. Hybrid

## Short-Term Financing Options

Short-term financing options (< 1 year) include:

- Bank overdrafts
- Trade credit
- Factoring and invoice discounting
- Short-term loans
- Commercial paper

## Medium-Term Financing Options

Medium-term financing options (1-7 years) include:

- Term loans
- Hire purchase
- Leasing (operating and finance)
- Medium-term notes

## Long-Term Financing Options

Long-term financing options (> 7 years) include:

- Corporate bonds
- Preference shares
- Ordinary shares (equity)
- Retained earnings
- Venture capital
